page.title: 10BOTANIC GARDENS NESTON CONT.
page.content: {Ness Gardens.} The wildlife consists of squirrels, rooks, ducks, moorhens, garden birds, insects and pond life. Weedkillers such as 245T and farmers burning stubble are a threat to the garden and its wildlife. The visitors come all the year round and even when there is snow on the ground there is at least one visitor in the garden. There are about 80,000 visitors per year. The 80,000 includes O.A.P.'s, members of the W.I., School parties and, of course, the general public. The most popular time of the year for visiting are, May to June, Whitsuntide, the autumn and July. Ness Gardens are the only botanic gardens in the country to have a visitor's centre to cater for coach parties etc. on wet days.
